episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom delivers the mail and a pain to his own heart.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 173, Salt & Strong Men
episodes.summary: Bloom's mood changes: he seems to have a cloud over him...

episodes.title: re: Joyce 173, Salt & Strong Men
episodes.summary: Bloom's mood changes: he seems to have a cloud over him...

episodes.title: re: Joyce 172, Hunchbacks & Hags
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom experiences a mood change - he's literally under a cloud.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 171, Perfect Oranges
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom reminisces about Jewish friends and their harvest festivals.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 170, Olives & Opportunity
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom, walking along the street, contemplates the sale of olive groves in the Middle East.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 169, Prime Meat and Policemen
episodes.summary: Mr Bloom thinks about the girl next door, but her boyfriend is a cop.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 168-A, Matters of Character
episodes.summary: The twelfth of Frank's "Baker's Dozen" podcast mini-essays; and this time he gives some added background to the major characters in Ulysses.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 168, Make Mine Meat
episodes.summary: Who's telling this story - Mr. Bloom or Mr. Joyce?

episodes.title: re: Joyce 167, Kidneys & Carpetbeaters
episodes.summary: A girl in the butcher's shop excites Leopold Bloom.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 166, Baloney & Geography
episodes.summary: Leopold Bloom licks his lips at sausages and hears children singing.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 165, Dribs & Drabs
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom calculates how a barman rises to own a pub.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 164, Cuteness & Codgers
episodes.summary: A barman makes an astounding declaration to Mr. Bloom

episodes.title: Re: Joyce, Episode 163: Ginger & Porter
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom ponders the sunburst, the bank of Ireland, and independence, among other things.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 162, Danders & Dulcimers
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom imagines sweet music, and we think of a sweet sad song.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 161, Bread & Sherbet
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom is musing on exotic flavors of the east, and crusty hot bread from Dublin

episodes.title: re: Joyce 160, Potatoes & Keys
episodes.summary: Mr. Bloom leaves home, but how will he get back in again?

episodes.title: re: Joyce 159, Stamps & Hatbands
episodes.summary: As Mr. Bloom prepares breakfast for his wife, he thinks of her father, the Major.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 158, Enter Mr Bloom
episodes.summary: We meet one of literature's most famous and delightful characters, Leopold Bloom of Eccles Street Dublin.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 157, Proteus Redux
episodes.summary: Frank casts a brief backward glance over ChapterThree.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 156A, Now Read...
episodes.summary: Yet another Baker's Dozen edition: The Introduction from the brand-new eBook, re: Joyce Volume One, which contains the transcripts of the first dozen podcasts.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 156, Shells & Ships
episodes.summary: In which Stephen, his teeth bothering him, leaves Sandymount Strand as Chapter Three ends.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 155, Lucifer & Lord Byron
episodes.summary: Here we have a delightfully tricky cluster of references that range from Satan to a horse race in France.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 154, The Rattle of Change
episodes.summary: Stephen has a few zombie thoughts about how a corpse will be changed by the sea.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 153 Weaving Waves
episodes.summary: Stephen listens to the rhythm of the waves and thinks of weavers at the loom.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 152, Water Music
episodes.summary: Stephen makes a contribution to the seven seas.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 151 Boots & Shoes
episodes.summary: Stephen considers having put himself in other people’s shoes.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 150, High Noon
episodes.summary: Stephen has an unhealthy thought for the Book of Genesis.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 149, Touch & Go
episodes.summary: Touch & Go, Stephen dreams of yellow stockings and apple dumplings.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 148, Sex & Stereoscopes
episodes.summary: In which Stephen, naughty boy, takes the meaning of “ineluctable” a little farther.

episodes.title: re Joyce 147, Shovel Hats & Shadows
episodes.summary: In chapter 3 Frank discusses emblematic illustrations, bishops, religion and Aristotle.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 146, Seeing Stars
episodes.summary: As Stephen continues to write poetry we learn of Cassiopeia, augurs and their flights of birds, along with Freud, Jung, and Telemachus.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 145, Taking Note
episodes.summary: Frank discusses two quotes, one simple, one opaque, the latter filled with hidden symbolism, sexual desire and the connections that make them sing.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 144-A, Who is Sylvia?
episodes.summary: Frank talks about Sylvia Beach and her part in brining Ulysses to the world.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 144, Womb to Tomb
episodes.summary: Frank discusses Joycean phrases including "Pin it Down" along with actor Kevin Spacey.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 143, Kissing
episodes.summary: Stephen still on Sandymount. "Omnis caro ad te veniet." A pale vampire, and Douglas Hyde. Hamlet's tablets.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 142: Blood & Candles
episodes.summary: Still Proteus, still on Sandymount Strand, Stephen watches the "gypsy woman" pass. The handmaid of the moon. Bride-, child-, and death-beds.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 141, Prince of Tides
episodes.summary: The couple passes Stephen on the beach, and he wonders if the woman wonders about him - or his hat. Saint James, Hamlet, and Eve.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 140: Prayers & Slang
episodes.summary: A bit of song: The Rogue's Delight and The Canting Academy. Morose delectation. Stephen muses on monkwords versus roguewords.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 139: Bussing & Wapping
episodes.summary: Stephen contemplates the lingo of rogues, and Frank introduces us to Thomas Harman and Richard Head.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 138: Egyptians & Cant
episodes.summary: The cocklepickers become Gypsies in Stephen's mind. Bing awast to Romeville.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 137: Dream On!
episodes.summary: Stephen's dream, almost. Haroun al Raschid. Adverb becomes verb.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 136: Panther and Paws
episodes.summary: The dogs digs; Thomas Gray's Elegy. Spouse-breach and pards, and Brunetto Latini's Tesoretto.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 135: Cocklepickers and Dogsbodies
episodes.summary: Tatters, the cocklepickers' dog, encounters a fallen comrade on Sandymount Strand and is called away. In Memoriam.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 134: Of Mice and Morse
episodes.summary: Still on Sandymount Strand: a dog, depicted with a painter's eye, barks at the sea. Heraldry. Seamorse… or seamouse?

episodes.title: re: Joyce 133: Cool, Cool Water
episodes.summary: Stephen thinks of drowning, and his mother's death. Tide and change.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 132A: Re: Joyce for Christmas
episodes.summary: In this bonus episode a few days before Christmas, Frank discusses the final tale of The Dubliners: The Dead.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 132: Barking at Boccaccio
episodes.summary: Stephen, dwelling on insults, thinks of the Decameron - and of his own failures of courage and athleticism.

episodes.title: re: Joyce 131: Whales & Gigolos
episodes.summary: Still on the same paragraph, Frank considers Walter Harris's The History and Antiquities of the City of Dublin as a source for Joyce. Moving on, the dog barks, and Stephen imagines himself a stag at bay. Famous pretenders.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 130: Torcs & Tomahawks
episodes.summary: A running dog on the beach. Stephen thinks of Lochland raiders, and of ancient Dubliners attacking beached turlehide whales.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 129: Teeth & Bones
episodes.summary: Just over halfway through Chapter 3, Proteus, we continue last week's passage. Sir Lout the gigant, and a live dog.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 128: Sand & Stone
episodes.summary: Stephen ascends from the tide, in both thought and motion, but finds only weeds, rocks, and rats. Louis Veuillot on Gautier, and an Arabian tale of sand and stone that may or may not be off-topic.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 127: Homeless With Hamlet
episodes.summary: Stephen doesn't want to spend another night at Martello tower; luckily, his soul walks with him. Elsinore.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 126: Time & Tide
episodes.summary: A return from Paris to Sandymount Strand, and the Kish lightship. Depressions in sand and soul, and time passing.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 125: Bombs & Ballads
episodes.summary: Paris still remembered on the Strand. Kevin Egan used to be a fine figure of a boy. Old bombs, old exiles, and old songs - and we're done with kevin Egan.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 124: Betrayals and Disguises
episodes.summary: Continuing a paragraph, Kevin Egan in the Paris of Stephen's memory. Victoria and Maud Gonne, Millevoye and Faure. Bathtime. Next paragraph: the bomber smokes, and muses on the jailbreak of James Stephens.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 123: Matadors & Shepherds
episodes.summary: Conversations in Paris. Dalcassians, Arthur Griffith, pimander. Stephen as his father's son in Kevin Egan's eyes. A shirt tells a story.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 122: Fairies and Cheese
episodes.summary: Stephen still remembers Paris with Kevin Egan and Patrice: gunpowder cigarettes, absinthe, milk, coffee, and postprandials.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 121: Lovers and Tarts
episodes.summary: The smell of Paris, a sensual meditation, and a bit of French farce. Giacomo Joyce.

episodes.title: Episode 120a: Five More Dubliners
episodes.summary: Frank takes a look at four more stories from The Dubliners in this poorly-named episode: A Painful Case, Ivy Day in the Committee Room, A Mother, and Grace.

episodes.title: Episode 20: Farls and Absinthe
episodes.summary: Pained memories, and a song. Sense-memories of Paris.

episodes.title: Episode 119: Sadness and Souvenirs
episodes.summary: Columbanus, Fiacre, and Scotus. Stephen's return from Paris, with dirty magazines and a fateful telegram.

episodes.title: Episode 118: Shooting & Shaking
episodes.summary: Stephen's remembered self, still in Paris, walks like the dispossessed - and murders in his mind. The Linati schema.

episodes.title: Episode 117: Puce in Paris
episodes.summary: Nostalgia for Paris: medical studies and cheap stew, ticket stubs and alibis.

episodes.title: Episode 116, Rabbits & Geese
episodes.summary: Thinking of Paris and Irish expatriates: Patrice, dynamite, and wild geese. The Michelet view of women, and a little French dialogue.

episodes.title: Re: Joyce 115: French Fun
episodes.summary: Stephen is not going to his aunt's house after all. Kevin Egan, and the works of the blasphemous M. Leo Taxil.

episodes.title: Episode 114: Nets and Shells
episodes.summary: Musings on the sand, shells, lost ships, and sewage. A stogged bottle, and Christ imagery on a clothesline.

episodes.title: Episode 113: Under a Cloud
episodes.summary: Stephen imagines his writings lasting an epoch, a mahamanvantara. Then: back to the third-person narrative of grainy sand and squeaking pebbles.

episodes.title: Episode 112: Epiphany Time
episodes.summary: Still Chapter 3, on the Sandymount Strand. Stephen reflects on his childhood reading habits, literary ambitions, and private conceits.

episodes.title: Episode 111: Naked Women
episodes.summary: Stephen will never be a saint, for various reasons.

episodes.title: Episode 110: Razors & Nonsense
episodes.summary: Still on Sandymount Strand. "Dan" Occam, the invincible doctor. Imagined bells and twinned principles.

episodes.title: Episode 109: Menace and Echo
episodes.summary: Priests move through Stephen's mind, in the sort of passage that got Joyce in trouble. Three bells mark three Eucharists.

episodes.title: Episode 108a: More Dubliners
episodes.summary: Frank delves into the second five stories of the Dubliners.

episodes.title: Episode 108: Bald Heads and Lantern Jaws
episodes.summary: Stephen recalls friends and priests by nickname, and considers Jaochim Abbas, that old heretic.

episodes.title: Episode 107: Heretics and Houyhnhnms
episodes.summary: Stephen ponders his family's fall from grace. Joachim Abbas. Frank unpacks "the rabble."

episodes.title: Episode 106: Whiskey and Whistling
episodes.summary: In Stephen's mind (still on Sandymount Strand), his uncle offers him food and drink, of a sorts. Second-hand opera, and a note of warning.

episodes.title: Episode 105a: Meeting Joyce
episodes.summary: A special episode celebrates Bloomsday 2012 on June 16. Frank introduces us to the first five stories of Dubliners as a way of "getting into Joyce."

episodes.title: Episode 105: Irish Bull
episodes.summary: An imagined domestic scene, mock heroism, and Stephen's nuncle. Differing versions of the text, and contradictions. Names unpacked, and a poignant poem.

episodes.title: Episode 104: A Little Swearing
episodes.summary: In Stephen's mind, his father continues to mock his mother's family, and Stephen visits his uncle's cottage.

episodes.title: Episode 103: Cost Accountants and Cornet Players
episodes.summary: Sandymount Strand. Stephen's thoughts: his father's voice editorializes on his mother's family. To illuminate, Frank calls on the Iliad, and Thersites's rant against Agamemnon.

episodes.title: Episode 102: Taking the Air
episodes.summary: Chapter 3 continues along Sandymount Strand. Wind and waves, Hamlet, and a god of the sea.

episodes.title: Episode 101: Who Is Arius?
episodes.summary: Stephen on the nature of the trinity, and the fate of heresiarchs. Contransmagnificandjewbangtantiality.

episodes.title: Episode 100: Carnival Knowledge
episodes.summary: Still on Sandymount Strand. Stephen ponders his own origins and, for the first time, reflects on his father.

episodes.title: Episdode 99: Madam, I'm Adam
episodes.summary: Still on the beach, Stephen muses on Eve, bellybuttons, bucklers, and a good deal of poetry.

episodes.title: Episode 98: Something Binary
episodes.summary: Stephen ascribes a crime to the midwife on the beach. A phonecall to the navel of the world.

episodes.title: Episode 97: Ladies and Liberties
episodes.summary: Chapter 3 returns to "normal" narrative for a moment. Women descend to the sea. Swinburne.

episodes.title: Episode 96a: Reading Lists
episodes.summary: In this bonus episode, Frank describes Joyce's reading list, which owed so much to his Catholic education.

episodes.title: Episode 96: Pentameters and Prosody
episodes.summary: Stephen parses the poetry of his own thoughts, and opens his eyes to see if the the world has persisted. It has.

episodes.title: Episode 95: Walking on Proust
episodes.summary: Stephen's thoughts echo his steps as he walks on shells. Frank digresses on Proust.

episodes.title: Episode 94: Walking Into Eternity
episodes.summary: Stephen walks blindly in borrowed boots and trousers. Los demiurgos and William Blake.

episodes.title: Episode 93: Time And Space
episodes.summary: Stephen closes his eyes and walks in the audible world. Nacheinander and Nebeneinander.

episodes.title: Episode 92: Another Maestro
episodes.summary: More thoughts on Aristotle, by way of Berkeley, Johnson, and Boswell.

episodes.title: Episode 91: Seeing Through
episodes.summary: Slightly deeper into chapter 3. Diaphanous reality, and a quick lesson on Aristotle.

episodes.title: Episode 90: Time for a Change
episodes.summary: The beginning of chapter 3, Proteus. Stephen's stream of consciousness takes over as he walks along the beach.

episodes.title: Episode 89: Bye Bye Nestor
episodes.summary: End of Chapter 2: Nestor. A brief summary.

episodes.title: Episode 88: Befriending Bullocks
episodes.summary: Stephen finally pries himself away from Mr. Deasy, and a recurring theme is introduced.

episodes.title: Episode 87: Women and Slogans
episodes.summary: Mr. Deasy's litany of women who ruined things for everybody.

episodes.title: Episode 86: History's Nightmare
episodes.summary: Joyce the symbolist. History may or may not be moving towards God.

episodes.title: Episode 85: Golden Geese
episodes.summary: Stephen reflects vividly upon Mr. Deasy's rant.

episodes.title: Episode 84a: Joyce Enjoying Joyce
episodes.summary: Frank unfolds Joyce's daily life in Zurich, which he in many ways abandoned to live in the Dublin of his Ulysses.

episodes.title: Episode 84: Light and Dark
episodes.summary: Mr. Deasy expounds upon the Jews.

episodes.title: Episode 83: Braggadocio and Bigotry
episodes.summary: Mr. Deasy, in addition to his other qualities, is a paranoid and a bigot.

episodes.title: Episode 82: Foot and Mouth and Modernism
episodes.summary: A letter to the editor, deconstructed.

episodes.title: Episode 81: Pluterperfect Predictions
episodes.summary: Reflections on hockey and history. Stephen reads - or at least scans - a letter.

episodes.title: Episode 80: Runners and Riders
episodes.summary: Waiting in Mr. Deasy's office, Stephen is transported by the art on the walls.

episodes.title: Episode 79: Rocky Roads and Rebels
episodes.summary: Stephen fails to warm to Mr. Deasy's arguments.

episodes.title: Episode 78: Covenants and Croppies
episodes.summary: Stephen debates Mr. Deasy - in his own mind, at least.

episodes.title: Episode 77: Fogies and Torries
episodes.summary: Frank unpacks Mr. Deasy's politics.

episodes.title: Episode 76: Folds and Fillibegs
episodes.summary: Mr. Deasy and Stephen continue their exchange, and Frank unpacks the tartan from a painting of a prince.

episodes.title: Episode 75: Credit and Debt
episodes.summary: Stephen tallies his debts - as does Joyce.

episodes.title: Episode 74: Proud English Words
episodes.summary: Mr. Deasy expounds on the power of money; Frank digresses.

episodes.title: Episode 73: Shy Haste
episodes.summary: Stephen is paid, meticulously.

episodes.title: Episode 72a: Joyce the Impressionist
episodes.summary: In this bonus episode, Frank draws from Frank Budgen's memoir to illuminate Joyce's painterly grasp of detail and language.

episodes.title: Episode 72: Shells and Shillings
episodes.summary: A little financial arrangement.

episodes.title: Episode 71: Of Coins and Spoons
episodes.summary: As Stephen waits in the headmaster's study, we learn something about its inhabitant.

episodes.title: Episode 70: At Last, Nestor
episodes.summary: A new character enters the stage in the longest and least complicated passage yet.

episodes.title: Episode 69: Dark Palaces
episodes.summary: More on mothers, their love, and secret childhoods.

episodes.title: Episode 68: A Trio of Dudes
episodes.summary: Stephen dwells on ancient philosophers: Averroes, Moses Maimonides, Bruno.

episodes.title: Episode 67: Dance Music
episodes.summary: Moors, math, foxes, and the dead.

episodes.title: Episode 66: Mother Love
episodes.summary: Eyeing the student Sargent, Stephen considers saints, sons, and mothers.

episodes.title: Episode 65: Out of the Shell
episodes.summary: Stephen's reflections on a poor student plumb the limits of a mother's love.

episodes.title: Episode 64: Blind Man's Bluff
episodes.summary: A boy stays after class, and Joyce toys with both authority and identity.

episodes.title: Episode 63: A Lot of Nonsense
episodes.summary: As Stephen's class lets out, a riddle is asked and answered, satisfying nobody.

episodes.title: Episode 62: God and Caesar
episodes.summary: Stephen is a somewhat merciful teacher. Musings on Jesus, government, and riddles.

episodes.title: Episode 61: In a Paris Library
episodes.summary: Stephen's classroom; a library in Paris; Blake and Aristotle; dragons and souls.

episodes.title: Episode 60a: The Writing of Ulysses
episodes.summary: Observations on the author, and the history of Ulysses.

episodes.title: Episode 60: Living at This Hour
episodes.summary: In Stephen's classroom, Joyce brings in Milton. Reflections on drowning.

episodes.title: Episode 59: A Tile Off the Roof
episodes.summary: In Stephen's musings on history, real and potential, Frank finds a recurring Joycean theme.

episodes.title: Episode 58: A Disappointed Bridge
episodes.summary: Stephen muses on first-rate wit and second-hand history.

episodes.title: Episode 57: A Touch of Class
episodes.summary: In Stephen's classroom, four girls' names hint at religion, class, and sex.

episodes.title: Episode 56: The Cookie Crumbles
episodes.summary: In Stephen's classroom, Frank muses on the names of cookies and of boys.

episodes.title: Episode 55: Making the Point - of a Spear
episodes.summary: Stephen continues his lesson, and we learn something of both Pyrrhus and Nestor.

episodes.title: Episode 54: Who is Nestor?
episodes.summary: We begin Chapter 2, and find Stephen in the classroom with old battles, radical poets, and the daughters of memory.

episodes.title: Episode 53a: Happy Bloomsday!
episodes.summary: June 16 is Bloomsday, as well as the one-year anniversary of this podcast.

episodes.title: Episode 53: Horns and Hooves
episodes.summary: Mulligan bathes, and Stephen takes his leave. The end of chapter 1.

episodes.title: Episode 52: A Side of Ribs
episodes.summary: Gossip at the swimming hole: an unlikely officer, redheads, supermen, and missing ribs.

episodes.title: Episode 51: A Little Exposure
episodes.summary: Stephen, Mulligan, and Haines encounter bathers, and Joyce employs some foreshadowing with news of Mulligan's brother.

episodes.title: Episode 50: Weaving The Wind
episodes.summary: Stephen fathoms the depths of both Hell and Dublin Bay, and Frank muses upon T. S. Eliot.

episodes.title: Episode 49: Holy Heresy
episodes.summary: Stephen presents us with a roll call of heresiarchs.

episodes.title: Episode 48a: Matters of Character
episodes.summary: In this bonus episode, Frank discusses the four characters we've met so far, along with their real-life antecedents.

episodes.title: Episode 48: Creeds Not Deeds
episodes.summary: Stephen considers the Church.

episodes.title: Episode 47: Masters and Servants
episodes.summary: Stephen claims to serve three masters.

episodes.title: Episode 46: Freethinking Walking Sticks
episodes.summary: Haines asks Stephen about a personal god, and Stephen answers - out loud, briefly, and to himself, at great length.

episodes.title: Episode 45: Faith and Cigarettes
episodes.summary: Stephen and Haines share a moment and a smoke.

episodes.title: Episode 44: Only Joking
episodes.summary: Mulligan capers, versifies, and blasphemes.

episodes.title: Episode 43: More Fathers and Sons
episodes.summary: Haines dwells on Hamlet, and we are reminded of the famous sons of that play, the Odyssey, and - of course - the Bible.

episodes.title: Episode 42: From Noah to Zeno
episodes.summary: Mulligan plays with paradox, and we get a foreshadowing of Stephen's father.

episodes.title: Episode 41: A Drink With Thomas Aquinas
episodes.summary: We learn the price of both a rented tower and a lecture on Hamlet.

episodes.title: Episode 40: Eggs for Sale
episodes.summary: Punctuation obfuscates; but we press on, and find significance in Stephen's walking stick.

episodes.title: Episode 39: A Latin Quarter Hat
episodes.summary: Mulligan is full of contradictions.

episodes.title: Episode 38: Hammocks and Holdfasts
episodes.summary: We have a bit of a breather while Stephen and Buck debate what, if anything, Stephen's aphorisms are worth.

episodes.title: Episode 37: A Touch of Inwit
episodes.summary: Stephen's inner voice, a presumption of remorse, and a few words on Ireland's climate.

episodes.title: Episode 36b: Joyce's Early Life
episodes.summary: Literature and lore in Joyce's Dublin.

episodes.title: Episode 36: Quarts and Florins
episodes.summary: In a rare uncomplicated passage, milk is measured, and Frank describes the various types of junkets.

episodes.title: Episode 35: Mulligan's Milk
episodes.summary: Levels of respect: for women, doctors, and the Irish language.

episodes.title: Episode 34: The Re: Joyce Rap
episodes.summary: Frank Delaney offers a special surprise in honor of James Joyce's Birthday.

episodes.title: Episode 33: Silken Kine
episodes.summary: The old woman carries, not just milk, but an allegory of Ireland herself - at least in the eyes of both Stephen and Joyce himself.

episodes.title: Episode 32: Old Mother Ireland
episodes.summary: More scholarship of folklore. The milk arrives, and its bearer is mocked by Mulligan and venerated by Stephen.

episodes.title: Episode 31: Something Fishy
episodes.summary: Mulligan gets mythic, and mocks exactly the sort of thing this podcast is doing.

episodes.title: Episode 30: Joking Joyce
episodes.summary: Petulance for breakfast, "pet" and "kip," and a dirty joke about the tea.

episodes.title: Episode 29: James Street
episodes.summary: A key is found, a door opened, breakfast is served, and various profanities are narrowly avoided, for once.

episodes.title: Episode 28: The Black Panther Returns
episodes.summary: We sit down to a fortified breakfast, and meet Haines and his dream. Also: more blasphemy.

episodes.title: Episode 27: Who's Serving Whom?
episodes.summary: Stephen sees ceremony and symbolism in a shaving bowl.

episodes.title: Episode 26: The Buck is Back
episodes.summary: Stephen is called to breakfast by Buck, and hit up for a loan at the same time. All is not forgiven.

episodes.title: Episode 25: Prayers for the Dying
episodes.summary: We translate Stephen's prayers for the dying from the Latin, and return immediately to both Homer and Shakespeare.

episodes.title: Episode 24a: 2nd Bonus Edition-  Formation
episodes.summary: In his second bonus podcast, Frank discusses Joyce's formation on the Island of Saints and Scholars.

episodes.title: Episode 24: Don't Be Afraid
episodes.summary: Stephen's mother is placed in the structure of the cosmos.

episodes.title: Episode 23: Thanks for the Memory
episodes.summary: Stephen, still brooding, summons memories of his mother's life, and we learn something of pantomime.

episodes.title: Episode 22: Of Beads and Birdcages
episodes.summary: Stephen remembers, poetically and tragically, his mother's deathbed.

episodes.title: Episode 21: Watch The Cloud
episodes.summary: As Stephen stands alone on the tower, we muse upon the painterly language of the seascape.

episodes.title: Episode 20: Fergus and Friends
episodes.summary: Mulligan, descending the stairs, trivializes his own insults - and musters considerable literary resources to do so.

episodes.title: Episode 19: Bacon and Hamlet
episodes.summary: Stephen absorbs Mulligan's insults and, standing upon the tower by the sea, once again recalls his Shakespearean precedent.

episodes.title: Episode 18: Who's The Impossible Person?
episodes.summary: Mulligan boldly defends himself against Stephen's charge, and dissects death  - and Stephen himself - in the process.

episodes.title: Episode 17: Ideas and Sensations
episodes.summary: We touch on one of the most important themes of Ulysses, and perhaps in all of writing.

episodes.title: Episode 16: Now You See It, Now You Don't
episodes.summary: A few thoughts on the Celtic spirit, and on what, exactly, can be seen from Martello tower.

episodes.title: Episode 14: What's in a Name?
episodes.summary: We dig through some more insults, and ponder the names of characters who don't, in fact, appear in the novel.

episodes.title: Episode 13: Is it All Greek to You?
episodes.summary: A single word produces lessons on the Greek language, politics, and cultural criticism.

episodes.title: Episode 12a: Baker's Dozen - James Joyce's Origins
episodes.summary: Stepping away from the narrative for a moment, Frank gives us a look at Joyce's education, his family, and his conflicted relationship with the Catholic church.

episodes.title: Episode 12: The Schmoozing Buck
episodes.summary: Stephen and Mulligan fence - or, alternately, joust.

episodes.title: Episode 11: A Cracked Looking Glass
episodes.summary: The looking glass evokes both Shakespeare's Caliban and Oscar Wilde's Dorian Gray

episodes.title: Episode 10: Is Stephen Insane?
episodes.summary: As the insults mount, Stephen faces his own reflection.

episodes.title: Episode 9: James Joyce's Hamlet
episodes.summary: We find meaning - and a Shakespearean precedent - in Stephen's black clothing.

episodes.title: Episode 8: The Voice Inside Stephen
episodes.summary: Getting past Mulligan's accusations of mummery, we enter Stephen's thoughts and encounter his dead mother.

episodes.title: Episode 6: A Panther and a Gun
episodes.summary: Frank describes the real life figure behind the character Haines.

episodes.title: Episode 5: The Voice of Stephen
episodes.summary: In this next installment we hear from Stephen Dedalus.​

episodes.title: Episode 4: A Bit of Blasphemy
episodes.summary: Jame's Joyce's blasphemy still has power today.  Listen to Frank Delaney investigate the next section of Ulysses.

episodes.title: Episode 3: Getting to Know Stephen
episodes.summary: Episode Three in which we learn more about Stephen Dedalus including the origins of his name.

episodes.title: Episode 2: The Mocking Continues
episodes.summary: Frank Delaney continues his reading of James Joyce's Ulysses.  This podcast covers paragraphs two and three of the first chapter and introduces the character Stephen Dedalus.

episodes.title: Episode 1: We Meet Buck Mulligan
episodes.summary: Frank Delaney begins with the first chapter of Ulysses and introduces the character of Buck Mulligan.

episodes.title: Episode 0 - Introduction to Joyce's Ulysses
episodes.summary: Frank Delaney introduces his weekly podcast on James Joyce's Ulysses.
